item.title: Handke to get Heine Prize
item.description: Depite (or because of ... ?) Peter Handke's French Comedy-issues he has now been named as the recipient of the 2006 Heine Preis.

item.title: Grass bashes Bush
item.description: Apparently a fun start to the 72nd International PEN Congress, as Nobel laureate Guenter Grass went in for some George jr. Bush bashing.

item.title: Slate's pulp week
item.description: Apparently, It's Pulp Fiction week at Slate.

item.title: New VLS
item.description: A new issue of the Voice Literary Supplement is available online.

item.title: New Bookforum
item.description: Parts of the Summer issue of Bookforum are now available online.

item.title: French Book Art exhibit
item.description: The New York Public Library has an interesting looking exhibit on: French Book Art.

item.title: Literary Translator panel
item.description: Emerging Writers Network offers an E-Panel of Literary Translators, with six participants.

item.title: Premio Camoes
item.description: Angolan author Jose Luandino Vieira takes the 100,000 euro prize.

item.title: International PEN Congress
item.description: The 72nd International PEN Congress is being held in Berlin this week.

item.title: The Din in the Head review
item.description: The most recent addition to the complete review is our review of Cynthia Ozick's new essay-collection, The Din in the Head.

item.title: New Akutagawa
item.description: There's a new Penguin Classics translation of stories by Akutagawa Ryunosuke out by Jay Rubin.

item.title: Japanese Fiction Project
item.description: Other interesting Japanese doings: the Japanese Fiction Project: Emerging Writers in Translation.

item.title: Australian covers
item.description: The Australian Publishers Association will announce the winners of its National Book Design Awards on Monday.

item.title: Literary Ventures Fund
item.description: Bob Thompson offers a good overview of the fledgling (if not brand new) Literary Ventures Fund in A Rule Breaker On Capitalizing Book Titles in The Washington Post.

item.title: NYTBR-25
item.description: The New York Times Book Review's recent search for the best American novel of the past 25 years certainly did what we presume it was intended to -- attract a lot of notice. There was even a BEA panel on it .....

item.title: J.S.Mill at 200
item.description: It's the two hundredth anniversary of John Stuart Mill's birth, and it's good to see he's getting some attention.

item.title: Book fair in Iraq
item.description: They held a book fair in Iraq a few days back, the Erbil International Book Fair and Library Equipment Exhibition.

item.title: Literary translation from and into Russian
item.description: Victor Sonkin reports on a recent conference on Russian Language in Translation.

item.title: Is it ever ...
item.description: This week's leader in The Bookseller gives the depressing news that Love 'em or hate 'em, celebrities publishing books are here to stay.

item.title: Qassem Haddad profile
item.description: In Al-Ahram Weekly Rania Khallaf profiles Qassem Haddad: The penman of Manama.

item.title: A Castle in Romagna review
item.description: The most recent addition to the complete review is our review of Igor Stiks' A Castle in Romagna.

item.title: New African Writing
item.description: Is print-on-demand the solution for African publishing ?

item.title: The School of War
item.description: Kaelen Wilson-Goldie, writing in the Daily Star, is not impressed by Alexandre Najjar's The School of War.

item.title: Ignacio Padilla reviews
item.description: The most recent additions to the complete review are our reviews of two titles by Ignacio Padilla.

item.title: Sexiest 25 ?
item.description: Playboy list The 25 Sexiest Novels ever Written.

item.title: Tony nominations
item.description: The Tony nominations are out.
